inn1.comm: Billy Stelling switches on the right channel. Just outside off, short of driveable length, hint of away movement and left alone
Gotcha! Stelling nails de Villiers. Short in length, well outside off and de Villiers couldn't resist a flash. All he got was a under edge which was safely pouched by the 'keeper.
Full in length, just outside off, driven back to the bowler
Just outside off again. Good stuff from Stelling. Moves away a touch and Kallis respects it by shouldering arms
Even better! Closer to the off, and then it shapes away. Lovely movement. Kallis lets it go past him
A cracking maiden wicket over! This one was pushed away to the off side.
Back of length, on the middle and leg, shapes towards the hips, worked straight to square-leg.
Fuller, straighter, on the middle stump line, moves in a touch. Smith leans forward to defend.
Electric fielding! Fullish and on the leg and middle, Smith whips it across to the left of short midwicket where a fine diving stop is made
On the hips, tucked behind square-leg for a single. Smith is up and away.
full in length, outside off and Kallis heaves his frame forward and offers the full face of the bat in defense
full and swinging in, Smith goes hard at it, the bat-handle rotates and the bat face shuts, the ball rolls towards the bowler
Will get a single this time. Didnt go too hard at it, just placed it to the right of mid-on
in the zone outside off, left alone
lands on a good length, just outside off, moves away, Kallis adjusts his hands to tackle the movement, and pushes it to point
Gets a single with a dab down to third man
Again that bat-handle rotates. Again he pushes hard and the ball rolls over the to the on side
Length delivery on the middle stump line, punched towards mid-on
hurls it through the channel outside off, left alone
lands on the good length, on the off stump line, Kallis gets behind the line, pushes it back to the bowler
Leans forward to a length-delivery, around off stump line, pushes it to the off side
fuller and around off stump line, Kallis shuffles across, wrists it towards mid-on
Shuffles across the stumps and shoulders arms at a length delivery shaping away from him
Full and outside off, Smith, again, tries to punch it straight, his technique sends the ball to the leg side
lands on a good length, on the middle, goes on with the angle, defended away down the track
strays a touch on to the pads, nudged past square-leg for a single
swing there. Outswing and Kallis is opened up a touch and plays it inside out towards short cover
strangling line and length, around off, hint of movement away, Kallis leans towards it, sees the movements, pushes his bat out and guides it to cover point. Excellent bowling
fuller, around off, inviting a drive, Kallis obliges but can't beat the cover fielder
In the channel outside off, left alone
lands on a length, angling away, guided to point
oh ho! Smith breaks free with a dance down the track. Hits through the line and up she disappears over long-off. He doesn't like being tied down. Not by the Dutch atleast.
runs this one down to third man for a single
full and straight, on middle and leg, whipped to short midwicket
beaten by the swing but ends up driving a fullish delivery on the middle stump towards short cover.
lands outside off, veers further away, Smith leans forward, opens the bat-face, runs it to third man for a single
South Africa crave for freedom! Now Kallis breaks free with a imperious on-the-up shot over mid-off.
inswing to Smith who pushes at it hard and gets a inside edge to behind square leg
Almost dragged on. Kallis predetermines another assault. Throws his bat at a length-delivery, gets a inside-edge and it rolls over behind square-leg.

Almost run out! Smith guides a length-delivery towards backward point and sets off. Kallis responds and rushes to the other side and just about makes it in time. A direct hit would have been interesting
Wide delivery outside off and Smith reaches out and slashes it past point
Now a cute dab to third man. Not much swing, just angling away outside off and he leant back to cut it.
full in length, outside off, driven to extra cover for a single
drifts on to the pads, whipped past square-leg for a couple. A misfield by the fielder standing behind square-leg and as a result they will get two.
beauty! This one jags back in after landing on a length outside off.. Kallis is surprised by the nip-backer, stabs at it and the ball threads the bat and pad gap and thuds into the mid-riff
leans forward to a straight delivery on the middle stump line and defends. Caution Caution is the buzz word now.
And again.

Stolen single. Almost a run out. Again. Kallis drills towards cover, deflected by the short cover fielder and they run for the misfield. Old adage - never run on a misfield almost came to haunt them. The throw just missed the sticks by a coat of varnish . If it had hit, Kallis was a goner
slightly short in length, sliding away outside off, cut to point
bit of width outside off and Kallis square-drives it past point. Typical Kallis shot.
strays on to the legs and Smith makes him pay with a flick past square-leg
pushes this one wide outside off, Smith reaches out for it, drives but can't beat the lunging cover fielder
Full and outside off, Smith sends it to long-on.
Down the leg side, Smith, the 'keeper, moves across in a flash and takes the bails off in quick time. Appeals for a stumping but Kallis's back foot was inside the crease
Slash! Short in length and outside off, Kallis unfurls another classy square-drive. Eye-catching stroke.

Now he goes down town. Overpitched on the off stump line, Kallis leant forward and whipped it past the bowler. Almost flicked that straight drive. South Africa are cutting the ropes that Netherlands had wrapped around them.
Close to the off stump, short in length, Smith backs away to cut but straight to point
back of length, around off, punched to right of mid-off
slips down leg side, Kallis doesn't make contact and the ball rolls of the pads for a single.
on the off stump, just short of driveable length, Smith leans forward to push it to cover
on the off stump line, short of length, worked to midwicket
beaten! length-delivery that lands around off stump and slides away, Smith pokes at it and the ball teases the outside edge
drifts on to the legs, flicked away to deep square leg
full and on the middle stump line, driven to mid-on
again on the leg and middle, whipped away to square-leg where a tumbling stop is made
short and on the off stump line, Smith backs away to cut but straight to point
On the leg and middle, slightly short and Smith pulls it off the front foot to long leg
Wallop! Smith rushes down the track and heaves a full-length delivery over mid-on
Defended off the back foot to the leg side
Driven off the front foot to the covers. Easy single that time
Floated in, full ball, Smith drills it down the ground off the front foot
Similar ball to the right-hander but Kallis can't beat the short cover fielder
Floated in again.. de Leede looking for swing that time. Kallis drives it straight but Eric Szwarczynski pulls off a superb diving stop at mid-off
Driven to extra cover for a brace
BANG! Full and floated again, hardly any swing and Smith simply stands back, waits, swings his bat ferociously and collects a six over long-on. Beefy blow that
Wide and swinging outside off, Kallis tries to blast it through the covers but can't beat the field
Defended to the off side, cautiously played that time. Good probing ball outside off
Yorker length ball but way outside off, Kallis tries to glide it towards third man but can't make contact
Punched to the off side but no run again
BOSH! Full, straight and too easy for Kallis, who simply swings through the line and clatters it way over midwicket for a huge six. Warner Park is too small for Kallis' force
driven down the ground but no single
cover driven through the off-side gap for a single
down the leg side, big wide called
cut off the back foot for a single through square
wide of the off side and too easy for Smith, who just steers it past short third man for another four. An avalanche of boundaries here
Backs away way outside leg stump and carves it over cover for a three. Didn't time it well as the ball stopped before the fence but brings up his fifty
goes for the on-drive
full toss that time and Smith simply needs to make contact. Driven through extra-cover for yet another four
Overpitched on the middle stump line, driven to mid-on
again pretty full, on the middle stump line, driven to mid-on
bit of width outside off, drilled to cover
again flashy blade but no change in the scorecard. He backs away slightly to cut it but sends it straight to point
Low full toss on the off stump line, driven to left of Troost the captain who makes a diving stop at mid-off
another low full-toss, another drive and this time to long-on
Full and outside off, driven to cover
slightly short in length, just outside off, cut to deep point
overpitched on the leg and middle stump line, that's the production zone of Smith. He leans forward to drive it past mid-on
slow low full-toss on the off and middle, punched to long -off
slightly short in length, on the off and middle, driven on the up past cover
another drive but straight to cover this time
on the legs, worked to deep midwicket
Classy! Overpitched on the off stump line, driven inside-out to right of the sweeper cover

Run out chancce missed. leans forward to a length-delivery outside off and defends. Suddenly they rush across for single, the bowler moves across and flicks a throw at the striker's end but misses. If it had hit, he would have been a goner
Lands on a length, on the off and middle stump line, defended on the front foot
on target - good length and on the middle stump line, pushed back down the track
similar delivery but Smith pushes this through the left of the bowler
Another nice fluent drive, down to long-off
Overpitched on the off stump line, driven to long-off
short of length, coming in from outside off, punched through cover

Smith perishes slogging. Heaves, a fullish delivery on the middle stump line, across the line, gets a top edge and it skies towards backward point. After few nervous moments under the swirling ball, he holds on to it and the South African captain is back in the hutch
on the pads, attempts to work it to the on side, makes no contact and the ball rolls over the on side
full and outside offstump line, Gibbs reaches out, runs it down to third man
Beaten! In the channel outside off, Kallis goes for an expansive drive and ends up playing outside the line
hits the deck short of length, and goes on towards middle stump line, Gibbs tries to work it the on side and is rapped on the pad
leans forward and defends
lands on a length, outside off, driven to cover
short in length and little bit of width outside off, forced off the back foot to deep point
comes in from outside off, defended off the front foot
another length-delivery on the middle stump line, dabbed to the on side
slightly overpitched on the middle and leg, flicked through midwicket region
back of length, on the middle and off, Kallis leans forward, opens the bat-face, runs it towards cover point
on the leg and middle stump line, glanced to long leg
length delivery on the middle stump line, punched to midwicket
Good old outside edge for four. Low full toss, just outside off and Kallis tries to hit inside out and gets an edge
nudges a length delivery past pojnt
almost at the blockhole, on the leg and middle, whipped away to left of the diving square-leg fielder
length-delivery outside off stump line, Gibbs stabs at it, gets an inside-edge.
back of length, outside off, punched on the up to deep cover
on the middle and leg, full in length, Gibbs leans forward, dabs it behind square-leg
similar delivery but Kallis, unlike Gibbs, plays it straight. Full face of the bat and the ball heads to long off
Whack! Full and wide, bit of rubbish, and Gibbs creames it through extra cover
leans forward to defend a length-delivery to the off side
slightly slower, just outside off, Gibbs leans forward, pushes it to cover point and rushes across for a quick single
floats it outside leg, turns in, Gibbs attempts to sweep  but doesn't make contact
The legspinner offers a juicy full toss on the leg side and Gibbs swings it away merrily.
slightly short, on the legs again, pulled to long leg
better. His best delivery yet. Landed on a length, around middle and leg and turned. Kallis adjusts to the turn and guides it to off side
low dipping full toss on the middle and leg, driven to long on
full in length and just outside off stump, square-driven to deep point
back of length, on the off stump and punched through the line, down to long off
full and straight, just outside off, driven to left of cover and he sets off for a quick single. The fielder has a shy, a direct hit at the non-striker's end but Kallis makes it in time. Only just.
nudged to fine leg for a single
full and straight on the middle and leg, driven to long on
pitched outside off, on a length, nips back in, Gibbs is beaten as he tries to whip it across the line and the ball bounds off the thigh pad to the off side
lands on the middle and leg, drifts down, another failed sweep shot
lands on the off stump line, turns, pushed to the off side
driven to sweeper cover for a single
beaten! lovely flight, on the middle stump line and it breaks away. Kallis tries to guide it to the off side and is beaten
leans forward to drive a length-delivery to long off
slightly slower in the air, on the middle stump line, driven to long on for a single
Wristed away! It was well outside off and Gibbs flicks it from there, to long on
athletic stop at cover. Full in length, outside off and driven to right of cover where a full-length dive is done with panache
tossed up outside leg stump line, Kallis takes it on the full and on-drives it to right of long on where a fumble yields a boundary.
lands on the legstump line, turns, Kallis leans forward, pushes it to the off side

direct hit from deep cover! Kallis leans back to cut a shortish delivery to left of deep cover. He turns for the second run and makes it in time. The decision was refered upstairs. Not out was the verdict
lands on the off stump line, on a length, turns away, cut to deep point
Super strike! slightly short and turning away from off stump, Gibbs rocked back and hit it, deliberately, over extra cover.
ambles in, gentle floating delivery on the off stump, driven to cover
Whoa! four over cover! Another gentle stuff, outside off and Kallis drove it inside-out over cover. One-bounce over the boundary ropes.
67.9 mph delivery, outside off and drilled to deep cover
Oh ho! Up up and over long off. Another fullish delivery, outside off, and lofted over long-off
Kallis backs away a touch and square-drives a full-length delivery to point
Violence! Gibbs charged down the track and hoicked it over long on.
Murder! Floated on the leg and middle stump line and Gibbs sends it soaring over long-off.
Carnage! Flatter one this time but it makes no difference to Gibbs. He just stands there and delivers. This one also has been sucked over long off
Wah Wah! Low full toss and guess where this went Yep. A slap slog and it went over deep midwicket! He is going to go for 6 sixes in this over!
Short in length, on the off stump line and Gibbs rocks back and swat-pulls it over wide long off. SImply amazing. What a batsman. This is pure violence!
He has done it! One-day record. No one has hit six sixes in a row. GIbbs stands alone in that zone. And the minnow bashing continues!  Full and outside off and bludgeoned over deep midwicket
driven to midwicket
leans forward to drive to cover
low full toss, outside off, defended away
Gibbs is having a bash and how. This one -a full-length delivery outside off, has been smashed away to wide long off
The looter is gone!  The slaughter ends. He charges down the track and goes for another six but ends up holing out to Szwarczynski at long-on, who does very well to judge a spiralling skier
Fullish , on leg and middle, flicked past square-leg for a boundary. Runs keep coming here
fullish outside off, driven to right of sweeper cover
Boucher  joins in the fun. Leans forward and smashes a length-deliery past the bowler
On the middle stump line, swung to deep midwicket
driven down to long off for a single
full in length, outside off, punch-driven to deep cover
on the leg and middle stump line, glanced to backward square leg for a single
full and outside off, pushed past cover for a single
slightly short and on the middle, Kallis swings it to deep midwicket
Slap! Short in length, on the off stump and pulled over wide midwicket
super fielding down at long on. Darron Reekers is the man. The ball was heading to the boundary when he intervened with a dive to his right.
This is a abattoir! They are bleeding fours here. Kallis drills a fullish delivery straight down the ground.
Leans forward, drives to deep cover for a single.
backs away to the leg side, forces a length-delivery on the stumps, past cover
Whack! Short. Blink. A pull. Ball is being fetched from deep midwicket
They are just toying around with the bowlers here. A short of length delivery has been smashed down to long-on
Wow! This one was last seen screaming over long on! Fullish, on the stumps and Boucher just went through the line
Kallis reaches his 15th ODI ton in style. Biffed away over long-off.
fullish, on the middle and leg, driven to long on
Cover driven to sweeper cover for a single
Lofted over midwicket for another four. Massacre at Warner Park now
Full ball on middle and leg, drilled through midwicket for a single
On driven for another run. Tries for a big one but can't time it
Defended back to the bowler. Yorker length ball and Kallis can't manufacture much with that
Cover-driven for a single
Slower ball and on off, Boucher sweeps but can only manage a top edge to third man for another boundary. The runs aren't stopping here
Down the track and crisply timed to extra cover
Down the leg side and Boucher just stands there and whips it past short fine leg for a boundary. He's in line for the fastest fifty in World Cups
He's done it. The fastest fifty in World Cups. He goes past Brian Lara's 23-ball fifty against Canada in 2003. Down the leg side and clipped superbly behind square for four
BANG! Full ball on middle and leg and Boucher makes room and crashes it through midwicket for a one-bounce four

HUGE! This is unbelievable. It's the 14th six of the innings as Boucher creams a full ball straight over long-on for a maximum. Sri Lanka managed 14 in a match against Kenya in Kandy in 1996. And South Africa have equalled it now
On-driven for a single between long-on and midwicket. Tries for the big one but can't make proper contact
Ouch. Kallis goes for the slog over midwicket but the inside edge races away to fine leg for four more. They can't stop the boundaries the Dutch.
OH HO HO! Another record as Boucher just makes room and unleashes an almighty six over extra cover. This is turning into a bloodbath now

Straight drive, ball crashes into the non-striker's end stumps but the bowler is quick in his thinking, picks up the ball and tries to run-out Kallis by uprooting the stumps. Kallis, though, has made it back
Surprise! No six but only a mere square drive for a single. How boring.
Full toss and Kallis tries to slog. Can't time it and only manages a single to square leg
Full and straight. Much better from Borren and Boucher drives it straight back
Similar ball and Boucher gets underneath it to drive it past the bowler for a single
Blistering. Full ball on middle and Boucher simply stands and delivers, straight past the bowler for a sizzling four
Short ball and Boucher goes for the pull, edge flies to fine leg for a single
Kallis lofts over extra-cover but the fielder there can't get to a tough chance. Ball trickles for two. It's South Africa's highest score in World Cup history. And yes, we're still in the 40th over.
Short ball and Kallis can't even get to it. It's so erratic. Wide called and the ball races away to the fine-leg fence

CRACK! Way way over midwicket. Kallis swings neatly, brings out the pendulum arc and watches as the ball soars somewhere in the direction of Cape Town. This is the most sixes in an ODI innings. Trust me, it doesn't get better (worse if you're Dutch)
Take that! Bring out the photocopier and change the orientation a bit. Kallis goes straighter this time and pumels yet another mighty hit. Oh van Troost, what's next?
And that's the way to finish! Short ball and pulled away over midwicket for the last of the sixes. Kallis finishes in style and South Africa end on a mammoth 354 in 40 overs. What a mighty mess.

inn2.comm: Rushing through the channel outside off, left alone
pretty well outside off, again left all alone
Slightly closer to the off stump, hint of swing away, again the batsman is not interested
And again.   Pollock has turned on his favourite channel - outside off stump.
Deja-vu.
No points for guessing where this one went.
There we go again. Another dot ball. outside off.Pollock never gets tired.  The batsmen do and they get gobbled up behind the stumps.
Almost swallowed at mid-off. Banged in short, outside off stump, he shapes to pull, and ends up lobbing it towards mid-off where Langeveldt rushed forward desperately but couldn't reach it
fuller and well outside off, a shuffle across and then the shouldering of arms
similar delivery but this time he reaches out and drives but straight to cover
Whack! A super pull in front of square. Banged in short again, on the off stump line, he shifted his balance and pulled it in style.
Well outside off and fuller in length, he has a slash but meets thin air
In the Pollock channel, Zuiderent is not interested in the programming

Tragedy. Zuiderent pushes a length-delivery towards short midwicket and sets off. Reekers is not interested. he does take few steps but freezes after that. Zuiderent kept running, Reekers back pedalled. Zuiderent charges on and reaches the crease first. Reekers doesn't make a great effort to reach first.
Pollock greets the new batsmen with his usual just-outside-off offering. Left alone
Just like the previous few deliveries, this one alos was in the corridor outside off, left alone by Kervezee
Short of length, outside off, run down to thirdman for a single
rushes through the channel outside off, the batsman lets it go through to the 'keeper
And again.
banged in short, well outside off, swayed away
Nel also is tuning on to the Pollock channel. The batsman has been patient so far
Similar line, similar result.

That's the danger! Pollock, after taking away numerous deliveries, brings this one back in. It landed on the same spot that the others had pitched - on a length and outside off, but this one slided in. Zuiderent was so used to leaving everything that he repeated the robotic leave. To his horror the ball crashed into the off stump
short of length, on the off and middle, pushed to the on side. Pollock rushes across to make the stop
on the middle and leg, dabbed away, close on the leg side for a single
takes this one away. left alone. He is setting him up.
this one comes back in but the batsman is ready, dabs it to the leg side
pushes this one further outside off. Boucher comes into play
in the corridor outside off stump, he leans into the line and runs it down to third man
climbs up from short of length, around the off stump, pushed out to cover point
waist-high, just outside off, nudged down to third man
bit of bounce. Just outside off stump and he stands on his toes and pushes it out to cover regio
lands on short of length, outside off, punched to cover
closer to the off stump, full in length, leans forward, drives but the bat-face shuts and the ball rolls towards Pollock

Almost dragged back on to the stumps. Pollock changed the length, hit the short of length area, outside off and made it hold its line. The batsman stabbed at it, bat away from the body, and the ball rolled to his pads
fuller, on a good length, around off, shapes away a touch, Kervezee is dragged right across the stumps, opens-up in his stance as the ball moves away but adjusts to push it to the off side
leans forward and defends a length delivery to the off side
moves into the line of a length delivery, turns it towards mid-on for a single
full in length, driven to extra cover
on the hips, worked to the on side for a single
short in length, cut ferociously but straight to point
drifting on to the pads and Doeschate glances fine. Very fine. Four runs.
lands on a length, around off, straightens a touch and the batsman is squared-up as he pushes forward in defence. Gets a leading edge towards point
length-delivery on the middle stump line, defended to the on side
on a length, on the middle stump line, punched towards mid-on
on the middle again, worked towards mid-on
Hmm... And again. All the deliveries have come in slightly from a length and have been pushed to mid-on. Will he take the nexst one away?
Nope. he bring it in a touch from the off stump line, defended on the back foot
another one sliding in, attempted flick shot makes no contact and the ball rolls off the pads to short fine leg
Short of length, around off stump, pushed to cover
strangling line and length, around off stump, nudged to backward point
short of length, on the off stump line, punched to cover
short and outside off stump, Kervezee has a flash and a slash but no wood on the leather. Boucher gathers with little bit of oohs and aahs slipping from his mouth
short of length, comes in slightly from outside off, pushed towards mid-on
appeal for lbw but point of impact was outside off and he was playing a stroke. Full in length, lands just outside off, and he leans forward and the ball hits him just, only just, outside off stump.
in cutter this time. Another appeal for lbw but the height was the issue this time. Lands on a length, on the middle stump line, cuts back in and he is hit high on the pad in front of middle and leg.
drifts on the pad, worked to fine leg
walks across towards the off stump and flicks a length-delivery to fine leg
Nel continues to extract bounce. Just outside off and punched to cover
Wow! Where did that one come from. He just walked into the line of a length-delivery on middle and leg and helped it over square-leg. Super pick-up shot.
Ah! Predictable response. Screaming bouncer and he ducks under that.
Bosh! Full in length, outside off and Kervezee leans across, punches it on the up and through the cover region
full and straight, on the middle stump line, pushed out to mid-on
Full in length and just outside off, nudged to cover point
run-out chance missed! full in length, pushed towards short midwicket and they rush across. Prince swoops in, has a shy at the non-striker's end but misses. Had it hit .. it would have been fatal.
Wallop! Kervezee rings the room service and he is served a short and wide one. Thrashed past point. Super cut
Langeveldt corrects the line. on the middle stump line, defended back down the track
This Kervezee can bat. No runs here but a nice delectable shot. Full and just outside off, he leans forward to flick it to mid-on.
banged in short, rises chest-high, on the middle stump line, defended
drifting on to the pads, dabbed away to fine leg for a single
full, straight, on the off and middle stump line, Kervezee leans forward to defend.
offcutter on the middle stump line, worked to the on side
just outside off, pushed back down the track
Lands outside off, comes back a touch, Kervezee walks into it and wants to whip it across the line but doesn't make contact and the ball thuds into the pad
similar delivery but this time Kervezee chooses to play it with a straight bat and punches it to mid-off

almost a mix-up. Pushed to extra cover and he sets off for a run. The non-striker is not interested. de Villiers swoops in from cover, intercepts but fails to pick the ball cleanly and Kervezee makes it back in time
Kervezee falls to a pull shot. Banged in short and outside off, he fetches it from there, the ball hits the top half of the bat and balloons to Pollock at mid-on.
lands outside off stump, comes back in , defended on the back foot

almost played on! Again another short-pitched stuff from Langeveldt, he shapes to pull but gets it on the body. The ball drops dangerously close to the stumps and heads that way but he calmly kicks it away from the danger area
quick single. Good bounce from a length, and he stabs at it, gets an inside-edge on to the pads and it rolls away to the off side. And they rush across for a single
on the hips, tucked away to the leg side
short of length, on the off and middle, defended off the back foot
full in length, outside off, nudged to point
length-delivery, just outside off stump, comes in a touch, defended off the front foot
Short and bit of width outside off stump, cut down to third man
overpitched on the leg and middle stump line, jabbed to the leg side
climbs up a good length, around off and middle, van Bunge gets behind it and fends it away
bouncer, rears up throat-high, van Bunge takes the bottom-hand out of the bat-handle and pushes it away to the off side

appeal for lbw as a length-delivery comes in towards the middle stump. Doeschate stabs at it, bat and pad close together. The ball crashes into the pad first in front of middle and leg . Umpire Benson turns it down. It looked like it would have hit the leg stump but Benson thought it was going down. Close and a tough call.
Hall responds with a screaming bouncer, and ten Doeschate shapes to hook. Gets a top-edge and it flies over Boucher and to the boundary
on the off stump line, pushed to cover point
fuller, hint of inswing, jabbed back to the bowler
slightly short in length, outside off stump, cut to point
full in length, around off and middle, pushed away to the off side
slides it down the leg side and flicked away. Ashoka de Silva, the umpire, who is watching the game from the sidelines makes the stop!
banged in short and it rises above waist-high on the middle stump line, pushed away to point
fuller, on the middle and leg, turned to Gibbs at square-leg
fullish and on the pads, turned towards square leg off the pads

on the pads and given! pitched just a tad outside the line of off stump and coming in, van bunge tries to turn it to the on side but is caught at the crease, the ball strikes the top of the front pad, Hall goes up in appeal and Mark Benson raises the finger. Replays show the ball missing the stumps. Perhaps not the best decision
short of a length on middle stump, turned to square leg
slower delivery, tries to glide it past point, picked up by Herschelle Gibbs
Hall bowls it on middle and leg, Szwarczynski hits it towards the on side
short of a length outside off, Szwarczynski opens the face of the bat and glides it past point this time
bouncer, Szwarczynski ducks and lets it go
fifty up for Netherlands, though in streaky fashion, Szwarczynski tries to cut, plays away from his body and gets the under-cut, Boucher dives to his left, gets a glove to it but the ball beats him
pushed back to the bowler
defended back to the bowler on the front foot
good length outside off stump, Szwarczynski pushes it towards point
bouncer! Langeveldt strives for that extra yard of pace, Szwarczynski decides to do nothing with it and ducks
fantastic square drive! overpitched outside off, ten Doeschate gets down on his knees and finds the gap to perfection
pushed towards the on side
short of a length, directed on the body, ten Doeschate rocks back, turns his wrists and places it to the gap near square leg
short, dug in, ten Doeschate lets it go
defended to the on side
fuller, ten Doeschate drives through the line on the off side and sets off for the run immediately
length-delivery, angling on the off stump, pushed to point
similar delivery, this one has been nudged towards cover
Wah! cheeky and innovative! Lovely upper cut. Short, chest-high, just outside off stump, he leant back, upper-cut it over slips. There was a bit of edge involved but the shot was intentional.
just short of length, lands outside the off stump, comes back in, pushed towards cover
from slightly wide of the crease, on middle and leg, worked to the leg side
fullish, on middle and leg, dabbed to the on side
just short of driveable length, outside the off stump, dragging the batsman forward, pushed out to cover
back of length, on the off stump line, tapped close on the off side and off they go for a quick single
lands on the middle stump line, on a length, shapes in , tries a flck shot and it thuds into the pad
on the off stump, stabs at it, the bat-face shuts and the ball rolls over to the on side
play and a miss. In the channel outside off stump, and he tries to run it down to third man. Oohs and Aahs from Srinivas Raju, our scorer,
floats it on the off stump line, defended on the front foot
lands outside off, turns in, dabbed to fine leg
on the off stump line, he leans forward to dab it to the on side for a single
beaten. Tried to be to little cute there. Just outside off and he attempted to cut it late but fails
lands outside off, driven to mid-off
slightly short, on the off and middle, goes back to whip it across past square-leg
starts off with a short delivery outside off, cut to third man
leans forward to a delivery on the off stump line and pushes it out towards cover.
fuller and around off stump, keeps a touch low, guided to point
Whack! Walks down the track and slaps a shortish delivery over midwicket!
short of length, on the hip, turned behind square-leg
reverse sweep! Just outside the off stump, he attempts to reverse sweep, the ball runs off the gloves towards short third man
floated outside off, attempt to whip it away to the on side, bounds off the pads, in the air, towards Smith
almost edged to backward point. Tossed up outside off, charge down the track and a heave attempted but instead a leading edge takes the ball towards point. Valiant effort but it falls short
Gone this time! Smith changes tack and fires this one across. Surprises Doeschate who is beaten for pace as he tries to dab it to on side and is caught dead plumb
almost a leading edge back to Smith! turned in from outside off, and he tried to work it to the leg side but ..
cut away! Short of length delivery and just outside off stump, flashes at it and it runs down fine throught hte vacant slip region
fuller this time, outside off, driven to deep cover
short of length, around off, cut away to wide third man
another short of length stuff, another cut shot down to third man
Fullish, bit of in swing, on the middle stump line, jabs at it, gets an inside-edge which takes it down to fine leg
full and straight, around off stump, played towards cover
tossed up, outside off, driven back to the bowler
low full toss, quick through the air, driven through covers and Nel makes a neat diving stop near the ropes.
tosses this one wide outside off, driven down to sweeper cover
on the off stump line, worked to the leg side.

aha! gets into a tangle there! Charges down the track and Smith fires it down the leg side and Doeschate tries desperately to put bat to ball, so that he doesn't get stumped, manages to get pad behind the leather and escapes! Big smiles from both the bowler and the batsman
pushed to right of de Villiers at cover and they run the quick single.
full in length, lands just outside off, slides in a touch, defended to the off side.
slightly short in length, around off, cut to Gibbs at backward point
short in length, on the middle and leg, Doeschate stands on his right leg, and helps it to deep backward square leg
Full in length, comes in from outside off and Leede jabs at it and gets a inside-edge on to his pad. Lucky he got that little bit of wood, else he would have been dead in front
full and around off, nudged to cover point
down the leg side, short as well, pulled away
on the middle and leg, worked gently towards square-leg region
turns in from outside off, punched back to the bowler
slightly short and outside off, cut away to deep point
floated outside off , full in length, he pushes at it, gets a outside edge and it runs down to third man
shout for lbw. Angling in towards middle and leg stump line, pushes at it, gets a inside edge on to the pad and it rolls to the leg side

drills a fullish delivery down the ground but Hall turns in a super stop, diving to his right at mid-off. Then he fires jn a direct hit as well at the non-striker's end but the batsman just makes it in time. it was refered to third umpire.
short in length, on off and middle, pushed down the track
on the off and middle stump line, turned to midwicket
spins down leg side, Doeschate tries to help it down to fine leg but makes no contact
full toss and driven to long on
Boom! Tossed up outside off and he drives it powerfully through covers. Smith kicks the ground in disgust.
on the off stump line, from a length, defended towards cover
Clubbed away! short in length, on the middle stump line, and Doeschate rocks back to bludgeon it over deep midwicket
full and on the middle and leg, worked to square-leg
full and straight, Doeschate sends it back to where it came from. back to the bowler.
lands on a length, on off and middle, pushed to the bowler
on the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
comes down the track, Smith digs it short and he adjusts to tap it away to the off side
lands outside off stump, turns in a touch, defended on the front foot
Smash! Comes down the track, takes it on the full and swings it past the bowler.
another charge down the middle, Smith sees him coming and fires it on to the legs and the ball thuds into the pads

Doeschate's promising knock ends. Via a run out. Pity. Pushed to cover, both batsmen not sure whether they want a run. Take a few steps. Meanwhile de Villiers swoops on to the ball and Doeschate is sent back. He tries to scramble back home, at the non-striker's end,  but fails to beat the direct hit
short in length, bit of bounce, outside off stump, attempts to cut but makes no contact
short of length, just outside off, punched back to the bowler
streaky edge! In the corridor outside off stump, a slash and a outside edge.
on the leg and middle stump line, dabbed to fine leg
on the off stump line, worked past square-leg
drifting on to the pads, Borren nudges it to fine leg for a single
Biffed away! short and on the off and middle, de Leede rocks back to pull it past midwicket
lands outside off, turned to backward point
slightly short, on the off and middle, de Leede goes back and punches it past the bowler, down to long-on
full, right up there on off and middle, driven to mid-off
length-delivery, just outside off, guided to Gibbs at backward point
Gone! de Leede is back in the hutch. Full and straight, de Leede tries to heave it over mid-on, bat meets air and the ball meets the middle stump.
angling away outside off, van Troost tries to take his bat from the line, instead, ends up running it down through the slip region!
van Troost charges and has one almighty heave. No contact though and Boucher gathers.
slower one. Breaks away after landing on a length around off stump line, Van Troost gets his bat away from the line
on the off and middle, driven to Gibbs at midwicket
turns in from the off stump line, worked to backward square leg
lands outside off, spins in slightly, dabbed to the on side
low full toss, slap-slogged away to long on

Another run out. cut away to deep cover and they turn for the second run. Mistake. The throw from Kallis  comes in flat and fast, Smith takes it front of the sticks and whips the bails off and Borren is found short
full in length, outside off stump, pushed to cover point
lands on a length, outside off, bends back in, and Stelling is rapped on the pad, outside off stump, while pushing forward in defense
another length-delivery, just outside off, turned to Gibbs at backward point
bit more width and this one is run down to third man
van Troost backs away, exposing the stumps, and cuts a delivery on the middle stump line, straight to point

Captain takes out captain! a slower one from Kemp and van Troost again charges out, attempts a lofted shot but is deceived by the change in pace. Smith moves to his right from mid-on to take the catch. South Africa register thier biggest victory in one-day internationals
